TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class ListItem : System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor, System.Web.UI.IParserAccessor, System.Web.UI.IStateManager
.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ListItem extends System.Object implements class System.Web.UI.IAttributeAccessor, class System.Web.UI.IParserAccessor, class System.Web.UI.IStateManager

Docs.summary: Represents a data item in a data-bound list control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control represents an individual data item within a data-bound list control, such as a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> or a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control.
There are several ways to specify the text displayed for an item in the list control. The most common method is by placing text in the inner HTML content. The inner HTML content is the text between the opening and closing tags of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control. You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> property to specify the text displayed in the list control for the item.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property allows you to associate a value with the item in the list control, in addition to the text displayed in the control. For example, you can display text for an item in the list control, such as `"Item 1"`, and use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property to specify a value for that item, such as `"$1.99"`.
You can have any combination of the inner HTML content, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> properties set. The resulting HTML output for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control depends on the combination of these three properties that are set. For example, if all three properties are set as follows:
``` <asp:ListItem Value="Value 1" Text="Item 1">Inner 1</asp:ListItem> ```
The inner HTML content is used for rendered inner HTML content and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property is used for the `Value` attribute. The resulting HTML rendering output is:
``` <option value="Value 1">Inner 1</option> ```
The following table lists the combination of set properties and the corresponding property used for the rendered inner HTML content and `Value` attribute. The three columns on the left list the combination of set properties. The two columns on the right list which property value is used for the corresponding attribute.
|Inner HTML content|Text property|Value property|Rendered Inner HTML content|Rendered Value attribute| |------------------------|-------------------|--------------------|---------------------------------|------------------------------| |Set|Set|Set|Inner HTML content|Value property| |Set|Set|Not set|Inner HTML content|Inner HTML content| |Set|Not set|Set|Inner HTML content|Value property| |Set|Not set|Not set|Inner HTML content|Inner HTML text| |Not set|Set|Set|Text property|Value property| |Not set|Set|Not set|Text property|Text property| |Not set|Not set|Set|Value property|Value property| |Not set|Not set|Not set|Not set|Not set|
> [!NOTE] > Because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> properties each have a default value of an empty string, it is possible to have empty list items in the list control.
When a list control is displayed, any <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control with its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Selected%2A> property set to `true` appears highlighted in the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control provides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Enabled%2A> property to allow you to specify whether a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control is enabled or disabled. A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control that is disabled is dimmed to indicate that it cannot be selected. Use this property to disable a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control in either a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control or a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.
> [!NOTE] > You cannot use this property to disable a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
> [!CAUTION] > This control can be used to display user input, which might include malicious client script. Check any information that is sent from a client for executable script, SQL statements, or other code before displaying it in your application. You can use validation controls to verify user input before displaying the input text in a control. ASP.NET provides an input request validation feature to block script and HTML in user input. For more information, see [Securing Standard Controls](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f3e7718f-63d0-44a3-bd5f-48cc2059c2a8), [How to: Protect Against Script Exploits in a Web Application by Applying HTML Encoding to Strings](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/6f67973f-dda0-45a1-ba9d-e88532d7dc5b), and [Validating User Input in ASP.NET Web Pages](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4ad3dacb-89e0-4cee-89ac-40a3f2a85461).
## Examples The following example illustrates the use of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> controls within a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
> [!NOTE] > The following code samples use the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. Each code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).

MemberSignature.Value: public ListItem (string text, string value, bool enabled);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string text, string value, bool enabled) cil managed

Docs.param: The text to display in the list control for the item represented by the .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified text, value, and enabled data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |`Text`|The value of the `text` parameter.| |`Value`|The value of the `value` parameter.| |`Enabled`|The value of the `enabled` parameter.|
## Examples The following example demonstrates adding items to and removing items from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> controls. When an item is selected in the `ListBox1` control, a new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control with the same value can be created and added to the `ListBox2` control, if the `ListBox2` control does not already contain an item with that text. In this example the constructor is called with `enabled` set to `true`. If it was called with `enabled` set to `false`, the new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control would not appear in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[ListItem.ListItem4 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListItem.ListItem4 Example/CS/sourcecs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[ListItem.ListItem4 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListItem.ListItem4 Example/VB/sourcevb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of attribute name and value pairs for the that are not directly supported by the class.
Docs.value: A that contains a collection of name and value pairs.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Attributes%2A> collection to manage the attribute name and value pairs declared in the opening and closing tags of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>, but not directly supported by the class. You can programmatically add or remove attributes to the collection.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the list item is enabled.
Docs.value: if the list item is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Enabled%2A> property allows you to specify whether a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control is enabled or disabled. A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control that is disabled is dimmed to indicate that it cannot be selected. Use this property to disable a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control in either a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control or a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control.
> [!NOTE] > You cannot use this property to disable a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> control in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DropDownList> control or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListBox> control.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Enabled%2A> property to programmatically disable list items in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RadioButtonList> control. The first question asks the user to select the radio button that corresponds to the user's occupation. If the user indicates that he or she is not a developer, the list items in the second radio button list are disabled. The second question asks the user to select a primary programming language. This question is not relevant to a user that is not a developer.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).
<!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-csharp[ListItem.Enabled#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListItem.Enabled/CS/listitem.enabledcs.aspx#1)] --> <!-- TODO: review snippet reference [!code-vb[ListItem.Enabled#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/ListItem.Enabled/VB/listitem.enabledvb.aspx#1)] -->

Docs.summary: Serves as a hash function for a particular type, and is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is selected.
Docs.value: if the item is selected; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Selected%2A> property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> is currently selected in the list control that contains it. This property is commonly used, when iterating through a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> objects in a list control, to determine whether an item is selected.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Selected%2A> property when iterating through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl.Items%2A> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CheckBoxList> control to determine which check boxes are selected.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text displayed in a list control for the item represented by the .
Docs.value: The text displayed in a list control for the item represented by the control. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> property to specify or determine the text displayed in a list control for the item represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>.
> [!NOTE] > If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> property contains `null`, the `get` accessor returns the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property, in turn, contains `null`, <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> is returned.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool. For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
## Examples
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).

> [!NOTE] > If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Value%2A> property contains `null`, the `get` accessor returns the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem.Text%2A> property, in turn, contains `null`, <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> is returned.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool. For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
